body_html:
@drpngx @zheng-xq Everything that depends on the sanity checks step fails, because sanity checks don't pass. Looking at the log, I get the following message:

FAIL: buildifier found errors and/or warnings in above BUILD files.
buildifier suggested the following changes:
1530a1531

linkstatic = 1,

1537d1537
< linkstatic = 1,
1542d1541
< prefix = "adjust_hue_op",
1543a1543

prefix = "adjust_hue_op",

Please fix manually or run buildifier to auto-fix.

I never encountered this problem while building locally. I can make that change, but I'm wondering if that won't trigger other problems. Is there a way to run this sanity check step locally, without the entire CI infra, to see if that resolves the problem? Even in the absence of this change, I can build the _pywrap_tensorflow.so and pass //tensorflow/python:image_ops_test, etc.

Please let me know how you would like me to proceed.

body:
@drpngx @zheng-xq Everything that depends on the sanity checks step fails, because sanity checks don't pass. Looking at the log, I get the following message: 

> FAIL: buildifier found errors and/or warnings in above BUILD files.
> buildifier suggested the following changes:
> 1530a1531
> >     linkstatic = 1,
> 1537d1537
> <     linkstatic = 1,
> 1542d1541
> <     prefix = "adjust_hue_op",
> 1543a1543
> >     prefix = "adjust_hue_op",
> Please fix manually or run buildifier <file> to auto-fix.

I never encountered this problem while building locally. I can make that change, but I'm wondering if that won't trigger other problems. Is there a way to run this sanity check step locally, without the entire CI infra, to see if that resolves the problem? Even in the absence of this change, I can build the _pywrap_tensorflow.so and pass  //tensorflow/python:image_ops_test, etc.

Please let me know how you would like me to proceed.
